skaurilsarmy.name: Skauril's Army - Assault on the Elves

id-00001.name: Inerenerab
id-00001.description: Enchanted wooden box constructed by the Woodmen. Measures 12"x8"x6". Keeps herbs fresh for months or stores enough food to feed one person for a month. Given to each PC by the Woodmen.

id-00002.name: Gihellin's Dagger
id-00002.notes: Glows blue near creatures of Darkness (Orcs, Trolls, Spiders, etc.)
id-00002.description: Old family heirloom originally forged in Gondolin. The enchanted blade glows with a cold blue light when near creatures of Darkness (+5 bonus).

id-00003.name: Necklace of Deployment
id-00003.nonid_notes: Gold necklace that holds a large white opal
id-00003.description: Silver necklace bearing an amber medallion in the form of a compass rose. Worn by Skauril. Allows the wearer to cast Leaving on five creatures at the same time, sending them in up to six different directions.

id-00004.name: Emerald Ring of Elf-friend
id-00004.nonid_notes: Silver ring set with an emerald
id-00004.description: Emerald ring given by Thranduil to signify Elf-friend status. Bears no enchantment but is quite valuable and grants recognition among the Elves.

notes.p: AF0. Heals 1st and 2d degree burns, 1-10 hits resulting from heat.

id-00001.abilities: Lieutenant to Khaml the Easterling. Necklace of Deployment, Ring of Shielding. Commands army of 500+ Orcs and Men.
id-00001.description: Lieutenant of the Witch-king. Commands assault on Thranduil's Elves. Crafty, experienced, but values own life above all. Will abandon army to save himself.
id-00001.name: Skauril the Conjurer
id-00001.spells: Fire law, Water law, Wind law, Light law, Earth law, Ice law, Lofty Bridge, Living Change, Spirit Mastery, Spell Ways, Unbarring Ways, Directed Spells (all to 10th level). Animal Handling 45, Animal Healing 15.
id-00001.stats: Co86, Ag81, SD35, Me97, Re98, St74, Qu72, Pr63, Em100, In87

id-00003.abilities: Commander of Skauril's Orcs at the battle of the Gladuin. Wields 'Reaver' +15 two-handed sword of slaying Dwarves. Darkvision.
id-00003.description: Largest and most brutal of the Uruks. Commands through fear and terror. His own troops fear him more than the enemy.
id-00003.name: Natak
id-00003.stats: Co96, Ag85, SD71, Me74, Re78, St93, Qu81, Pr91, Em65, In80

id-00004.abilities: Tracking, Stalking, Hiding, Ambush. Bitter hatred of Easterlings. Will kill Skauril if given easy opportunity.
id-00004.description: Self-trained ranger turned bandit turned assassin. Lost family to Easterling raiders. Enrolled in Skauril's company but secretly hates his Easterling master.
id-00004.name: Gardagd

id-00005.abilities: Iron weapons. Leads units of bandits in Skauril's army.
id-00005.description: Experienced soldier who has turned to raiding. Commands respect through competence rather than fear.
id-00005.name: Sergeant

id-00006.abilities: Iron weapons. Low morale - will flee if battle goes badly.
id-00006.description: Desperate men driven to banditry by war and hardship. Fight reluctantly and flee quickly.
id-00006.name: Bandit

id-00009.description: Skilled scouts in Skauril's army. Used for reconnaissance and trap detection.
id-00009.name: Scout

id-00010.abilities: Steel weapons. Basic infantry in Skauril's forces.
id-00010.description: Common soldiers forming the bulk of Skauril's human forces.
id-00010.name: Warrior

p.i: Darkvision; Partially blinded by sunlight (-50 to all activity)
Darkvision; Partially blinded by sunlight (-50 to all activity)

id-00016.abilities: Low steel weapons. Form the core of Skauril's orc forces.
id-00016.description: Lesser orcs pressed into service. Fight better than expected due to fear of their commanders.
id-00016.name: Orc Warrior

id-00017.abilities: High steel weapons. Elite orc warriors. Darkvision.
id-00017.description: Larger and more skilled uruks who serve as sergeants in Skauril's forces.
id-00017.name: Uruk Sergeant

id-00018.abilities: High steel weapons. Commands scouting units. Darkvision.
id-00018.description: Battle-hardened uruk commanders who lead scouting and raiding parties.
id-00018.name: Uruk Leader

id-00019.abilities: +40 Stalk & Hide, +30 Track. Steel weapons. Darkvision.
id-00019.description: Orcs trained specifically for tracking and hunting. Used in scouting and foraging parties.
id-00019.name: Tracking Orc

p.i: Darkvision; Dislike, but can operate normally in sunlight.
Darkvision; Partially blinded by sunlight (-50 to all activity)
Darkvision; Dislike, but can operate normally in sunlight.

text.h: Chapter 6: Skauril's Army - Assault on the Elves

text.p: This adventure assumes the PCs recovered the scroll from Bulkupar in Chapter 5. If not, another messenger can bring warning to the Woodmen.

text.frame: The Woodmen examine the scroll with grave concern. Waulfa looks up from the parchment, his weathered face showing rare alarm. 'Skauril marches against the Elves. We must warn Thranduil, but his warriors are scattered. Someone must slow this army, or many Elves will die.'

text.p:
The Witch-king has sent Skauril three duplicate scrolls ordering an assault on Thranduil's Elves. The scroll reads:
'SkaurilMy forces raid in Arthedain, keeping the eyes of the foolish Elf-friends facing my kingdom. Now must you assault Aradhrynd. Hasten. Although Thranduil's house guard numbers less than 200, he will assemble more warriors if you delay too long. Leave no later than two days past the full moon. Good Blood, Angmar'
The attacks in Arthedain are meant to distract the Wise while Skauril attacks the Elves. A victory would greatly lengthen the shadows of Mirkwood.

Bulkupar's map shows the location of Skauril's caverns (starting point). The Elves' house guard numbers only 100not enough to defend outlying settlements. Skauril cannot penetrate Aradhrynd fortress, but hopes to destroy many Elves in the surrounding area.
Waulfa can send 30 Woodmen troops, but they will barely arrive in time. For each day Skauril is delayed, the Elves can muster more warriors.

text.frame: Gihellin the Elf steps forward. 'I will carry word to Thranduil with all haste, but my people are scattered throughout the forest. The house guard alone cannot stop this army.' Waulfa nods gravely. 'If someone could slow the army, track its numbers, or demoralize its troops, the Elves would have time to gather their strength.'

text.p:
If the PCs agree to scout and delay Skauril's army, the Woodmen will provide: - Reasonable supplies and normal equipment - Healing herbs (all they can spare) - Inereneraban (enchanted food boxes) for each PC - stores 1 month of food in a 12"x8"x6" box - Gihellin's magic dagger (glows blue near creatures of Darkness, heirloom from Gondolin)
Gihellin will draw a map showing trails between Skauril's caverns and Aradhrynd. One line marks the path Skauril must use to move a large force. Unknown: how Skauril plans to cross the enchanted river Gulduin.

Born to a Gramuz family in the East Bight. At age 10, his father contracted a wasting disease. The family struggledGardagd hunted in Mirkwood to add meat to the table.
Returning from one hunt, he saw smoke rising from his home. He found smoldering ruins: father dead, mother and sisters carried off by Easterlings.
Cursing Easterlings, Gondorians, and the world, he returned to the forest. He learned that Men were easier prey than beaststheir silver bought food and supplies. He became a bandit.
Once he tried to rob an agent of Skauril (attracted by a fat purse) and was brought before the Conjurer. Skauril saw potential and enrolled him as a scout/assassin.
Gardagd secretly hates Easterlings and will kill Skauril if given an easy opportunity.

Young Sindar Elf warrior raised north of Aradhrynd. Footloose and friendly with both Elves and Men. Used as courier by Thranduil due to his knowledge of woodland paths.
Arrived in Buhr Widufiras bearing a message to Waulfa. Will make a swift courier back to Aradhrynd to warn the Elves.
Addresses willing PCs as 'Elf-friends' and offers his family heirloom dagger.

Always the largest of his brood in Dol Guldur. Never learned subtletynot as clever as his age-mates, but uses strength and terror to command.
Orcs under his command gladly leap to the front to attackit keeps them away from Natak himself.
Commands through fear and brutality.

text.frame: You set out into the dark eaves of Mirkwood, following Gihellin's map toward the trail Skauril's army must take. The forest grows darker as you travel deeper, the canopy overhead blocking much of the sun.

text.p:
The PCs must locate Skauril's army and begin their delaying actions. See encounter 6.5.01 for details on locating the army.
The army moves quicklyapproximately 15 miles per day on the trail. For each day the PCs delay the army, the Elves can muster more warriors for the final battle.

The PCs have Gihellin's map showing Skauril's probable route. Knowing the starting date and expected arrival time gives them an excellent indication of his speed.
The Woodmen assume Skauril uses a trail (only way to make such speed) and that his force is mostly Orcs (Men on foot couldn't sustain the pace).
Detection methods: - Trail: Routine (+30) Perceptionbeaten down by 500+ troops - Hearing: Easy (+0) Perception within 1/4 mile of any group - Campfire smoke: Easy (+0) Perception from treetops at dawn/dusk, within 3 miles of main camp - Other: Chance encounters with foraging parties, Path Tales, Nature's Awareness, talking to animals

The army is organized into several groups: - Bridge Crew (advance party, mounted) - Road Crews (clearing the trail) - Scouting Parties (detecting traps/ambushes) - Foraging Parties (gathering food) - Main Force (bulk of the army)
Each can be encountered separately.

text.frame: Through the trees ahead, you hear the sound of horses moving in single file. Voices call out in the harsh tongue of Men from the East.

text.p:
Composition: Mounted group in single file, led and followed by 3rd level Scouts.
Tactics: - Travel speed prevents Scouts from using Trap Detection efficiently (Extremely Hard -30) - If impeded by traps 2+ times: Ranger and Animist lead using Nature's Lore Trap Detection - If ambushed once: Ranger uses Nature's Awareness to avoid second occurrence - Retreat conditions: 75% losses OR 50% losses in single combat without killing attackers - Warriors/Scouts flee; Ranger/Animist try to warn Skauril

text.frame: The sound of axes and guttural Orcish curses echoes through the forest. A work crew is clearing brush from the trail ahead.

text.p:
Composition: 10 Orcs, 1 Man, 2 Wargs per unit. Multiple units working the trail.
Strengths: - Wargs smell anything upwind before it arrives - Keen hearing: -30 to Stalk/Hide/Ambush within 100 yards
Weaknesses: - Not well-organized or alert for traps - Orcs not valuedMan waits until 2-3 Orcs die before scouting ahead - Move slowly (ambushers may get cramps waiting)
Tactics: - Orcs won't retreat unless heavily overmatched - Warg and Man retreat after losing half the Orcs - Lack of distance weapons has little effect (only 10-20 feet clear range in woods)

text.frame: The forest has gone quiet. Through the undergrowth, you catch glimpses of dark shapes moving with purposeWargs and their Orc handlers, searching for signs of danger.

text.p:
Composition: 1 Uruk leader, 4 Tracking Orcs, 4 Wargs. Purpose: Locate traps and ambushes.
Strengths: - Alert and organized - Wargs make ambushes difficult - Shifting path limits trap effectiveness - More likely to ambush PCs than vice versa
Tactics: - Unlikely to enter pitched battle - Sound horns if attacked and unable to retreat - Dispatch tracking Orc to report at first sign of trouble - Note ALL signs: tracks, campfires, etc. - If they detect PCs: Track them while calling reinforcements (another Scout group + Mage/Animist)
Important: Outcome of battle with Scout group affects army morale!

text.frame: You hear movement through the forestnot the brutal chopping of the road crews, but the quieter sounds of hunters gathering food. Voices call softly in both Orkish and Westron.

text.p:
Composition: 1 Ranger, 1 Animist, 2 Scouts, 6 Orcs, 2 Wargs. Purpose: Gather food for the army.
Strengths: - Watchful and alert - May be using Nature's Awareness - Wargs/Rangers/Scouts make them very hard to surprise - Scouts and wandering path make traps difficult - Spell casters backed by Warriors make them formidable
Weaknesses: - Not organized for combat - Will avoid hostilities if possible
Tactics: - Will NOT track or attack PCs - Will report to Skauril and let other units deal with threat
Note: Probably the toughest satellite unit the party may face!

text.frame: Through the trees, you see the main body of the armyhundreds of Orcs, ranks of Men in dark armor, and at their center, a figure in robes that seem to drink in the light itself. This is Skauril the Conjurer.

text.p:
WARNING: Only exceptionally powerful and foolhardy characters would attack the main force directly.
However, PCs can weaken and demoralize the army:
1. DRAIN RESOURCES: - Thwart outlying parties to drain main army - Most spell casters will use power points for food/water and trap detection
2. TRAPS: - After 3+ successful traps, Skauril sends Scouts ahead to detect more - Cuts movement by 1/2 mile per day - Scouts traveling quickly: -20 to Trap Detection
3. INFILTRATION: - Change of Kind spells may allow penetration - If detected: Skauril increases night patrols by 10% (up to 3 times) - Then Rangers/Animists use Nature's Awareness for night watch - Plant Facade or Invisibility: Watch army pass, report organization - Long Ear: Learn Skauril's plans
4. RAIDS: - After 3 losses to main force (snipers/raids), Skauril uses magic to locate and attack with overwhelming force - By this point, close to Gulduindiscretion recommended - Flee to give information to Elves

text.frame: A rustling in the canopy above draws your attention. Eight massive spiders descend on silk threads, their mandibles clicking with hunger.

text.p:
8 Giant Spiders on the path. Hungry and aggressivewill attack all who cross (including Orcs).
Dangerous Gambit: - If sufficiently aggravated, Spiders will chase opponents all the way to Skauril's army - Risk: PCs caught between Spiders and Orcs - Leaving spell very effective here
Treasure: None

text.frame: Through the trees ahead, you hear the sound of running water. The trail leads to a wide, swift-flowing river. Its waters glitter with an unnatural sheen in the dim forest light.

text.p:
The trail intersects the Gulduin on the border of Thranduil's kingdom.
RIVER PROPERTIES: - No visible crossing - Anyone who touches or drinks: Deep sleep (may never awaken) - River is deepcrossing difficult and potentially fatal
THRANDUIL'S PLAN: - Stop Skauril at the river crossing - Use this obstacle to advantage
SKAURIL'S ORIGINAL PLAN: - Bridge crew builds bridge - Patrol far bank for Elves - Cross entire army on crude bridge - Hope to completely surprise the Elves

IF BRIDGE EXISTS: - Skauril crosses immediately - When fired upon: Pulls back, leaves bowmen/Mages to defend bridge - After consultation: Outflank using magic - Leaving, Limbwalking, Levitate: Send forces across 100 yards to either side - As battle joins: Rest charge across bridge (accepting losses)
IF NO BRIDGE: - Delay 1 day to construct - Use Invisibility + darkness to fell trees and string ropes across

text.frame: The clash of steel and the cries of Elves and Orcs echo through the forest. The battle for the Gulduin crossing has begun.

text.p:
Once beachhead established: Long battle as both armies become disorganized in the woods.
IF PCs JOINED ELVES: - GM may have them fight Orc detachment - Can use miniatures rules if desired - Or determine outcome on table in Section 9.0
ELVEN ADVANTAGE: - Better at woodland combat - Terrain advantage - Orcs almost certainly forced to retreat
SKAURIL'S ESCAPE: - Uses Necklace of Deployment if strongly threatened OR 60%+ losses without equal damage to Elves - Necklace: Cast Leaving on 5 creatures, send in up to 6 directions - Will abandon army and bodyguard to buy escape time
AFTER SKAURIL FLEES: - Army becomes disorganized and demoralized - Quickly routed by Elves - If not playing Section 7.0: Skauril captured or killed here

INITIAL REWARDS (from Woodmen/Gihellin): - Inereneraban (enchanted food boxes) - Healing herbs - Gihellin's Elven dagger
IF SUCCESSFUL IN DELAYING ARMY: - Thranduil gives emerald rings signifying Elf-friend status - Rings have no enchantment but are quite valuable
ADDITIONAL REWARDS: - Anything grabbed during the march - Share of spoils from Battle of Gulduin (offered by Thranduil)

SKAURIL'S NATURE: - Crafty and tactically experienced - Force is organized and well-disciplined - Reacts quickly to threats and changing situations
ORC NATURE: - Fond of direct approach - Impulsive (may rush 100 yards to attack archers) - Not valued by Skauril
TACTICS: - May use Orc suicide squads to flush PCs - Heedless of Orc losses to maintain speed - Won't waste magic needed for food on saving Orcs from traps
KEY POINT: The more the PCs can disrupt outlying units, the weaker the main force becomes.

description.p: Equipment and supplies from the defeated bridge crew
Loot from defeated road crew. Orcish equipment is crude and of poor quality.
Equipment from the scouting party. Tracking equipment of excellent quality, signal horn (orcish make), map fragment showing Skauril's route (if not destroyed).
Supplies and equipment from foraging party. Includes gathered food supplies (herbs, game, roots), hunting equipment (snares, skinning knives), and spell component pouch.

Thranduil's share of battle spoils offered to the PCs. Includes Elven cloak (grants +10 to Hiding in forest), bottle of Elven cordial (heals 1-10 HP), silver dagger (+5, non-magical but fine quality), and choice of weapon from Elven armory.

id-00008.name: Emerald Ring of Elf-friend
id-00008.nonid_notes: Silver ring set with an emerald
id-00008.description: Emerald ring given by Thranduil to signify Elf-friend status. Bears no enchantment but is quite valuable and grants recognition among the Elves.

description.p: Supplies provided by the Woodmen before departure. Includes 50 feet of rope, waterskins (full), fire-starting kit, and map drawn by Gihellin.

id-00010.name: Inerenerab
id-00010.description: Enchanted wooden box constructed by the Woodmen. Measures 12"x8"x6". Keeps herbs fresh for months or stores enough food to feed one person for a month. Given to each PC by the Woodmen.

id-00011.name: Gihellin's Dagger
id-00011.notes: Glows blue near creatures of Darkness (Orcs, Trolls, Spiders, etc.)
id-00011.description: Old family heirloom originally forged in Gondolin. The enchanted blade glows with a cold blue light when near creatures of Darkness (+5 bonus).

notes.p: AF0. Heals 1st and 2d degree burns, 1-10 hits resulting from heat.
